description.narrative: AAN's core activities are carried out to contribute to providing a solid ground for informed policy-making nationally as well as internationally through high-quality research and for seeking to ensure that Afghanistan stays on the international agenda and that important country-specific and wider thematic lessons are drawn for future policy-making. By the end of the intervention, the aim of AAN is for key stakeholders, i.e. Afghan policy-makers and the international community, to become significantly better informed and better equipped to formulate adequate policies, implement projects and lobby for necessary interventions, thanks to AAN's research and analysis. Its interventions, e.g. the publications of impartial, nuanced and research-based analyses as well as its weekly meetings with Afghan policy-makers, are expected to facilitate progress towards greater stability in Afghanistan (or, alternatively, help prevent greater deterioration). A significant part of the programme focuses on communication, making AAN's research available and accessible to key stakeholders. As part of this effort, AAN makes its research and analysis accessible and available in the public domain. In parallel, AAN strives to build and strengthen Afghan research capacity as a priority. The theory of change outlines that the use of AAN's research products can contribute to stakeholders' efforts for a more stable Afghanistan. AAN aims at inspiring Afghan researchers, increasing their capacity in regard to critical analysis, and increasing the public interest in issues regarding the Afghan society. AAN aims at reaching out to interested citizens in the Afghan public domain, as decision- and policy-makers, journalists, analysts and Afghan civil society. This also includes university professors and students. Monitoring reports show that AAN's audience mainly consists of readers with a specialized interest in Afghanistan.

Afghanistan Analysts Network (AAN) har ansökt om kärnstöd från Sida för finansiering av organisationens verksamhet 2020-2024. Sida föreslår ett kärnstöd på totalt 6 miljoner SEK för perioden 2020-2022. AAN har fått svenskt stöd sedan starten 2009.
Insatsen syftar till att afghanska beslutsfattare, internationella givare och andra medlemmar i AAN:s målgrupp blir bättre informerade och rustade att formulera politik, implementera utvecklingsinsatser och bedriva påverkansarbete genom att ta del av AAN:s analyser inom följande områden: krig och fred; det politiska landskapet, rättigheter och friheter; migration; regionala relationer; internationellt engagement; ekonomi, miljö och utveckling; samt kontext och kultur.
Övriga givare är i dagsläget Norge, Schweiz (SDC), Storbrittanien (DFID) och Rockefeller Brothers Fund. Budgeten är fortfarande inte täckt. Om AAN inte får inte tillräckligt med medel kommer budgeten att anpassas till detta.
Det finns en vitt spridd uppfattning bland afghanska analytiker och internationella experter att det internationella samfundet har en begränsad förståelse av Afghanistan och att detta har negativa effekter på givarnas insatser. Det är strävan att komma till rätta med detta problem som motiverar Sida att stödja AANs verksamhet med djupgående dokumentation och analys av utvecklingen i landet.
Sidas finansiella stöd till AAN motsvarar cirka 2 MSEK årligen.

Afghanistan Analysts Network (AAN) has applied for core support from Sida to finance the organization's operations in 2020-2024. Sida proposes a core support of a total of SEK 6 million for the period 2020-2022. AAN has received Swedish support since its inception in 2009.
The aim of the contribution is helping Afghan decision-makers, international donors and other members of AAN's target group become better informed and equipped to formulate policy, implement development efforts and conduct advocacy work by taking part in AAN's analyzes in the following areas: War and peace; the Political Landscape; Rights and Freedoms; Migration; Regional relations; International engagement; Economy, environment and development; and Context and culture.
Other donors are expected to be Norway, Switzerland (SDC), the UK (DFID and the Rockefeller Brothers Fund. The budget is still not covered. If AAN does not receive sufficient funds, the budget will be adjusted accordingly.
There is a widespread perception among Afghan analysts and international experts that the international community has a limited understanding of Afghanistan and that this has a negative impact on donor efforts. It is the endeavor to overcome this problem that motivates Sida to support AAN's operations with in-depth documentation and analysis of developments in the country.
Sida's financial support to AAN is approx. 2 MSEK annually.

participating-org.narrative: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

17.9 - Enhance international support for implementing effective and targeted capacity-building in developing countries to support national plans to implement all the Sustainable Development Goals, including through North-South, South-South and triangular cooperation.

17.9 - Öka det internationella stödet för genomförande av effektiv och riktad kapacitetsuppbyggnad i utvecklingsländerna till stöd för nationella planer för att genomföra alla målen för hållbar utveckling, inklusive genom samarbete nord–syd och syd–syd samt trepartssamarbete.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: AAN has published 80 reports, over published special reports and dossiers. Events have not happened because of COVID-19, but AAN will try to organize webinars in 2021. It has been a difficult year because of COVID-19, war and finance, but important for Afghanistan because of changing international engagement. AAN has managed to keep research going and to do important work and carried out a lot of briefings, media interviews and public panels, feeding into policy discussions on war, peace, aid and transitional justice. Published on US-Taliban, violence, impact of COVID-19, elections and published important landmark texts – rentier state.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
